thread.title: 21 attractions you wouldn't expect to see in France

author: Telegraph Staff
title: 21 attractions you wouldn't expect to see in France
text:
MORE... 
A molested tomb 
The tomb of French journalist Victor Noir - shot dead in 1870 in a duel with Pierre Bonaparte, the great-nephew of Napoleon - has become something of a fertility symbol owing simply to the fact that it has a noticeable bulge. Women flock to PÃ¨re Lachaise Cemetery in Paris in their hordes to rub the spot for luck bearing a child, as evidenced by its state of polished sheen.
